trans-unit.source: Move data to and from Azure SQL | Azure Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Move data to and from Azure SQL | Azure Data Factory

trans-unit.source: Learn how to move data to/from Azure SQL Database using Azure Data Factory.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to move data to/from Azure SQL Database using Azure Data Factory.

trans-unit.source: Move data to and from Azure SQL using Azure Data Factory
trans-unit.target: Move data to and from Azure SQL using Azure Data Factory

trans-unit.source: This article outlines how you can use the Copy Activity in an Azure data factory to move data to Azure SQL from another data store and move data from another data store to Azure SQL.
trans-unit.target: This article outlines how you can use the Copy Activity in an Azure data factory to move data to Azure SQL from another data store and move data from another data store to Azure SQL.

trans-unit.source: This article builds on the <link><linkText>data movement activities</linkText><title></title></link> article which presents a general overview of data movement with copy activity and supported data store combinations.
trans-unit.target: This article builds on the <link><linkText>data movement activities</linkText><title></title></link> article which presents a general overview of data movement with copy activity and supported data store combinations.

trans-unit.source: Sample: Copy data from Azure SQL to Azure Blob
trans-unit.target: Sample: Copy data from Azure SQL to Azure Blob

trans-unit.source: A <link><linkText>pipeline</linkText><title></title></link> with Copy Activity that uses <link><linkText>SqlSource</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>BlobSink</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: A <link><linkText>pipeline</linkText><title></title></link> with Copy Activity that uses <link><linkText>SqlSource</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>BlobSink</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The sample copies data belonging to a time series from a table in Azure SQL database to a blob every hour.
trans-unit.target: The sample copies data belonging to a time series from a table in Azure SQL database to a blob every hour.

trans-unit.source: The JSON properties used in these samples are described in sections following the samples.
trans-unit.target: The JSON properties used in these samples are described in sections following the samples.

trans-unit.source: The sample assumes you have created a table “MyTable” in Azure SQL and it contains a column called “timestampcolumn” for time series data.
trans-unit.target: The sample assumes you have created a table “MyTable” in Azure SQL and it contains a column called “timestampcolumn” for time series data.

trans-unit.source: Setting “external”: ”true” and specifying externalData policy informs the Azure Data Factory service that this is a table that is external to the data factory and not produced by an activity in the data factory.
trans-unit.target: Setting “external”: ”true” and specifying externalData policy informs the Azure Data Factory service that this is a table that is external to the data factory and not produced by an activity in the data factory.

trans-unit.source: Data is written to a new blob every hour (frequency: hour, interval: 1).
trans-unit.target: Data is written to a new blob every hour (frequency: hour, interval: 1).

trans-unit.source: The folder path for the blob is dynamically evaluated based on the start time of the slice that is being processed.
trans-unit.target: The folder path for the blob is dynamically evaluated based on the start time of the slice that is being processed.

trans-unit.source: The folder path uses year, month, day, and hours parts of the start time.
trans-unit.target: The folder path uses year, month, day, and hours parts of the start time.

trans-unit.source: The pipeline contains a Copy Activity that is configured to use the above input and output datasets and is scheduled to run every hour.
trans-unit.target: The pipeline contains a Copy Activity that is configured to use the above input and output datasets and is scheduled to run every hour.

trans-unit.source: In the pipeline JSON definition, the source type is set to SqlSource and sink type is set to BlobSink.
trans-unit.target: In the pipeline JSON definition, the source type is set to SqlSource and sink type is set to BlobSink.

trans-unit.source: The SQL query specified for the SqlReaderQuery property selects the data in the past hour to copy.
trans-unit.target: The SQL query specified for the SqlReaderQuery property selects the data in the past hour to copy.

trans-unit.source: Sample: Copy data from Azure Blob to Azure SQL
trans-unit.target: Sample: Copy data from Azure Blob to Azure SQL

trans-unit.source: A <link><linkText>pipeline</linkText><title></title></link> with Copy activity that uses <link><linkText>BlobSource</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>SqlSink</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: A <link><linkText>pipeline</linkText><title></title></link> with Copy activity that uses <link><linkText>BlobSource</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>SqlSink</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The sample copies data belonging to a time series from Azure blob to a table in Azure SQL database every hour.
trans-unit.target: The sample copies data belonging to a time series from Azure blob to a table in Azure SQL database every hour.

trans-unit.source: The JSON properties used in these samples are described in sections following the samples.
trans-unit.target: The JSON properties used in these samples are described in sections following the samples.

trans-unit.source: Data is picked up from a new blob every hour (frequency: hour, interval: 1).
trans-unit.target: Data is picked up from a new blob every hour (frequency: hour, interval: 1).

trans-unit.source: The folder path and file name for the blob are dynamically evaluated based on the start time of the slice that is being processed.
trans-unit.target: The folder path and file name for the blob are dynamically evaluated based on the start time of the slice that is being processed.

trans-unit.source: The folder path uses year, month, and day part of the start time and file name uses the hour part of the start time.
trans-unit.target: The folder path uses year, month, and day part of the start time and file name uses the hour part of the start time.

trans-unit.source: “external”: “true” setting informs the Data Factory service that this table is external to the data factory and not produced by an activity in the data factory.
trans-unit.target: “external”: “true” setting informs the Data Factory service that this table is external to the data factory and not produced by an activity in the data factory.

trans-unit.source: The sample copies data to a table named “MyTable” in Azure SQL.
trans-unit.target: The sample copies data to a table named “MyTable” in Azure SQL.

trans-unit.source: You should create the table in Azure SQL with the same number of columns as you expect the Blob CSV file to contain.
trans-unit.target: You should create the table in Azure SQL with the same number of columns as you expect the Blob CSV file to contain.

trans-unit.source: New rows are added to the table every hour.
trans-unit.target: New rows are added to the table every hour.

trans-unit.source: The pipeline contains a Copy Activity that is configured to use the above input and output datasets and is scheduled to run every hour.
trans-unit.target: The pipeline contains a Copy Activity that is configured to use the above input and output datasets and is scheduled to run every hour.

trans-unit.source: In the pipeline JSON definition, the source type is set to BlobSource and sink type is set to SqlSink.
trans-unit.target: In the pipeline JSON definition, the source type is set to BlobSource and sink type is set to SqlSink.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides description for JSON elements specific to Azure SQL linked service.
trans-unit.target: The following table provides description for JSON elements specific to Azure SQL linked service.

trans-unit.source: The type property must be set to: AzureSqlDatabase
trans-unit.target: The type property must be set to: AzureSqlDatabase

trans-unit.source: Specify information needed to connect to the Azure SQL Database instance for the connectionString property.
trans-unit.target: Specify information needed to connect to the Azure SQL Database instance for the connectionString property.

trans-unit.source: Note: You need to configure Azure SQL Database Firewall.
trans-unit.target: Note: You need to configure Azure SQL Database Firewall.

trans-unit.source: You need to configure the database server to <link><linkText>allow Azure Services to access the server</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You need to configure the database server to <link><linkText>allow Azure Services to access the server</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, if you are copying data to Azure SQL from outside Azure including from on-premises data sources with data factory gateway you need to configure appropriate IP address range for the machine that is sending data to Azure SQL.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, if you are copying data to Azure SQL from outside Azure including from on-premises data sources with data factory gateway you need to configure appropriate IP address range for the machine that is sending data to Azure SQL.

trans-unit.source: For a full list of sections & properties available for defining datasets, please refer to the <link><linkText>Creating datasets</linkText><title></title></link> article. Sections like structure, availability, and policy of a dataset JSON are similar for all dataset types (Azure SQL, Azure blob, Azure table, etc...).
trans-unit.target: For a full list of sections & properties available for defining datasets, please refer to the <link><linkText>Creating datasets</linkText><title></title></link> article. Sections like structure, availability, and policy of a dataset JSON are similar for all dataset types (Azure SQL, Azure blob, Azure table, etc...).

trans-unit.source: The typeProperties section is different for each type of dataset and provides information about the location of the data in the data store.
trans-unit.target: The typeProperties section is different for each type of dataset and provides information about the location of the data in the data store.

trans-unit.source: The typeProperties section for the dataset of type AzureSqlTable has the following properties.
trans-unit.target: The typeProperties section for the dataset of type AzureSqlTable has the following properties.

trans-unit.source: Name of the table in the Azure SQL Database instance that linked service refers to.
trans-unit.target: Name of the table in the Azure SQL Database instance that linked service refers to.

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Copy Activity type properties
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Copy Activity type properties

trans-unit.source: For a full list of sections & properties available for defining activities, please refer to the <link><linkText>Creating Pipelines</linkText><title></title></link> article. Properties like name, description, input and output tables, various policies etc are available for all types of activities.
trans-unit.target: For a full list of sections & properties available for defining activities, please refer to the <link><linkText>Creating Pipelines</linkText><title></title></link> article. Properties like name, description, input and output tables, various policies etc are available for all types of activities.

trans-unit.source: The Copy Activity takes only one input and produces only one output.
trans-unit.target: The Copy Activity takes only one input and produces only one output.

trans-unit.source: Properties available in the typeProperties section of the activity on the other hand vary with each activity type and in case of Copy activity they vary depending on the types of sources and sinks.
trans-unit.target: Properties available in the typeProperties section of the activity on the other hand vary with each activity type and in case of Copy activity they vary depending on the types of sources and sinks.

trans-unit.source: In case of Copy activity when source is of type SqlSource the following properties are available in typeProperties section:
trans-unit.target: In case of Copy activity when source is of type SqlSource the following properties are available in typeProperties section:

trans-unit.source: Use the custom query to read data.
trans-unit.target: Use the custom query to read data.

trans-unit.source: SQL query string.For example: select * from MyTable.
trans-unit.target: SQL query string.For example: select * from MyTable.

trans-unit.source: If not specified, the SQL statement that is executed: select from MyTable.
trans-unit.target: If not specified, the SQL statement that is executed: select from MyTable.

trans-unit.source: User specified stored procedure name to upsert (update/insert) data into the target table.
trans-unit.target: User specified stored procedure name to upsert (update/insert) data into the target table.

trans-unit.source: User specified table type name to be used in the above stored procedure.
trans-unit.target: User specified table type name to be used in the above stored procedure.

trans-unit.source: Copy activity makes the data being moved available in a temp table with this table type.
trans-unit.target: Copy activity makes the data being moved available in a temp table with this table type.

trans-unit.source: Stored procedure code can then merge the data being copied with existing data.
trans-unit.target: Stored procedure code can then merge the data being copied with existing data.

trans-unit.source: Wait time for the batch insert operation to complete before it times out.
trans-unit.target: Wait time for the batch insert operation to complete before it times out.

trans-unit.source: User specified query for Copy Activity to execute such that data of a specific slice will be cleaned up.
trans-unit.target: User specified query for Copy Activity to execute such that data of a specific slice will be cleaned up.

trans-unit.source: See repeatability section below for more details.
trans-unit.target: See repeatability section below for more details.

trans-unit.source: User specified column name for Copy Activity to fill with auto generated slice identifier, which will be used to clean up data of a specific slice when rerun.
trans-unit.target: User specified column name for Copy Activity to fill with auto generated slice identifier, which will be used to clean up data of a specific slice when rerun.

trans-unit.source: See repeatability section below for more details.
trans-unit.target: See repeatability section below for more details.

trans-unit.source: Column name of a column with data type of binary(32).
trans-unit.target: Column name of a column with data type of binary(32).

trans-unit.source: Type Mapping for SQL server & Azure SQL
trans-unit.target: Type Mapping for SQL server & Azure SQL

trans-unit.source: As mentioned in the <link><linkText>data movement activities</linkText><title></title></link> article Copy activity performs automatic type conversions from automatic type conversions from source types to sink types with the following 2 step approach:
trans-unit.target: As mentioned in the <link><linkText>data movement activities</linkText><title></title></link> article Copy activity performs automatic type conversions from automatic type conversions from source types to sink types with the following 2 step approach:

trans-unit.source: Convert from native source types to .NET type
trans-unit.target: Convert from native source types to .NET type

trans-unit.source: Convert from .NET type to native sink type
trans-unit.target: Convert from .NET type to native sink type

trans-unit.source: When moving data to & from Azure SQL, SQL server, Sybase the following mappings will be used from SQL type to .NET type and vice versa.
trans-unit.target: When moving data to & from Azure SQL, SQL server, Sybase the following mappings will be used from SQL type to .NET type and vice versa.

trans-unit.source: The mapping is same as the SQL Server Data Type Mapping for ADO.NET.
trans-unit.target: The mapping is same as the SQL Server Data Type Mapping for ADO.NET.

trans-unit.target: We would really appreciate your feedback on this article.
